body_html:
@martinwicke @ispirmustafa I think there's essentially a missing API on the Estimator side for allowing TensorBoard integration. Is there a solution for this?

When I was playing with Estimators earlier I was able to get some coordination between TensorBoard and Estimators by creating a SummarySaverHook when defining my model code, and then passing that into the tf.estimator.EstimatorSpec. But I don't think that works in this case where you use an off-the-shelf estimator.

When I was playing with Estimators earlier I was able to get some coordination between TensorBoard and Estimators by creating a SummarySaverHook when defining my model code, and then passing that into the tf.estimator.EstimatorSpec. But I don't think that works in this case where you use an off-the-shelf estimator.
body:
@martinwicke @ispirmustafa I think there's essentially a missing API on the Estimator side for allowing TensorBoard integration. Is there a solution for this?

When I was playing with Estimators earlier I was able to get some coordination between TensorBoard and Estimators by creating a SummarySaverHook when defining my model code, and then passing that into the tf.estimator.EstimatorSpec. But I don't think that works in this case where you use an off-the-shelf estimator.
